definitions.definition: to look at words or symbols and understand what they mean:
examples: He spent a pleasant afternoon reading (the newspaper/a book).

definitions.definition: to say the words that are printed or written:
examples: She read (the poem) slowly and quietly.

definitions.definition: to understand and give a particular meaning to written information, a statement, a situation, etc.:
examples: She missed the train because she read 18.30 p.m. as 8.30 p.m. instead of 6.30 p.m.

definitions.definition: How you read a piece of writing, or how it reads, is how it seems when you read it:
examples: The letter reads as if it was written in a hurry.

definitions.definition: (especially when communicating by radio), to hear and understand someone:
to read aloud to someone until they go to sleep:
examples: Every night when I was a child my father used to read me to sleep.
It's not brilliant but it's worth a read.
